metadata.title: CVE-2020-12825 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
libcroco through 0.6.13 has excessive recursion in cr_parser_parse_any_corein cr-parser.c, leading to stack consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-shell - 3.36.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
gnome-shell-common - 3.36.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
gnome-shell-extension-prefs - 3.36.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcroco package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
gnome-shell package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.36.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
